ground_truth: Brian smiles wryly with his arms folded, then leans forward and shakes the chairman's hand. On a crowded tourist beach by a Majorcan hotel, Brian is bare-chested playing football with his kids, while Peter cavorts around with them in the impromptu game. Fat holiday-makers laze on lounges as a man smears some cream over his obese folds. Brian kisses Peter's cheek playfully and holds his arms aloft to celebrate scoring, as Barbara frolics in the surf with Peter and the kids. Wearing aviator shades, Brian nods smiling, with them beckoning him to join. His face becomes sober as he turns over the back page of the paper to see the sport headline. By the hotel, a waiter points Brian out to a man in a panama hat and blazer, who wanders down the sandy beach carrying a briefcase towards Brian, now lying on his back in the sun. The man in the blazer dabs sweat from his face as he stands over Brian. Still wearing his shades and an intrigued expression, Brian raises himself up onto his elbows, looking up at Archer. Peter marches off along the jetty away from Brian, leaving him pacing furiously, hands on hips then on his head in despair. In a home game, a Luton Town player in orange stripe weaves through the lead-footed Leeds midfield as Bremner sulks beside Clough on the bench. Behind them, Don makes his way to a seat with the directors and eyes Brian gloatingly. A Luton striker scores and the Leeds fans cheer as Brian escorts his team down the tunnel, finding Cussins waiting. The Leeds players trudge into their dressing room as Cussins leaves Brian with his hands on his hips. Brian makes to follow Bremner into the dressing room but has the door slammed in his face. The players, now showered and in their fashionable clothes, join the directors in the long, narrow lounge, with Brian traipsing in last to face Cussins. A player obliges, as Cussins eyeballs Brian then turns to the players. Brian wrinkles his nose with distaste as Bremner, sat beside Giles, winks at him. Brian nods and swallows hard, his new young signings looking troubled as their manager steps into the corridor. Jimmy finds Brian outside the door, with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian smarts, straightens his jacket, and glances around the board members as Cussins glances at the other directors. Brian leads Nigel down the corridor, passing Don's photo, then finds himself in makeup for Yorkshire TV. The presenter knocks on the door, and Brian winks and smiles wistfully. Now, in the studio, the floor manager leads Brian to his seat before the cameras. Brian notices two other chairs and sits as the tall, handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dark studio into the lights of the set.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Brian grins slyly with his arms crossed, then inclines forward and grips the chairman's hand. On a packed tourist shore by a Majorcan inn, Brian is shirtless playing soccer with his children, while Peter frolics around with them in the spur-of-the-moment match. Rotund vacationers lounge on recliners as a man spreads some lotion over his corpulent creases. Brian pecks Peter's cheek teasingly and raises his arms high to celebrate scoring, as Barbara romps in the waves with Peter and the youngsters. Wearing pilot sunglasses, Brian nods grinning, with them motioning him to join. His face becomes serious as he flips over the back page of the newspaper to see the sport headline. By the inn, a server points Brian out to a man in a panama hat and blazer, who strolls down the sandy shore carrying a briefcase towards Brian, now reclining on his back in the sun. The man in the blazer blots sweat from his face as he stands over Brian. Still wearing his sunglasses and a curious expression, Brian lifts himself up onto his elbows, looking up at Archer. Peter strides off along the pier away from Brian, leaving him pacing angrily, hands on hips then on his head in desperation. In a home match, a Luton Town player in orange stripe maneuvers through the sluggish Leeds midfield as Bremner sulks beside Clough on the seat. Behind them, Don makes his way to a chair with the executives and observes Brian smugly. A Luton forward scores and the Leeds fans cheer as Brian guides his team down the passage, finding Cussins waiting. The Leeds players plod into their changing room as Cussins leaves Brian with his hands on his hips. Brian makes to follow Bremner into the changing room but has the door slammed in his face. The players, now cleansed and in their stylish attire, join the executives in the long, narrow lounge, with Brian trailing in last to face Cussins. A player complies, as Cussins stares at Brian then turns to the players. Brian crinkles his nose with aversion as Bremner, seated beside Giles, blinks at him. Brian nods and gulps hard, his new young recruits looking troubled as their manager steps into the hallway. Jimmy finds Brian outside the door, with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian aches, straightens his coat, and glances around the board members as Cussins glances at the other executives. Brian leads Nigel down the hallway, passing Don's photo, then finds himself in preparation for Yorkshire TV. The presenter taps on the door, and Brian blinks and grins longingly. Now, in the studio, the floor manager guides Brian to his seat before the cameras. Brian notices two other seats and sits as the tall, attractive presenter leads a bullish Don through the dim studio into the lights of the set.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Brian's wry smile is accompanied by folded arms, and the chairman's hand is shaken by him as he leans forward. On a crowded tourist beach by a Majorcan hotel, football is being played by a bare-chested Brian with his kids, while Peter cavorts around with them in the impromptu game. Lounges are lazed on by fat holiday-makers as some cream is smeared over his obese folds by a man. Peter's cheek is kissed playfully by Brian, who holds his arms aloft to celebrate scoring, as Barbara frolics in the surf with Peter and the kids. Wearing aviator shades, Brian nods and smiles, with them beckoning him to join. His face becomes sober as the back page of the paper is turned over by him to see the sport headline. By the hotel, Brian is pointed out to a man in a panama hat and blazer by a waiter, who wanders down the sandy beach carrying a briefcase towards Brian, now lying on his back in the sun. The man's face is dabbed of sweat by himself as he stands over Brian. Still wearing his shades and an intrigued expression, his elbows are raised onto by Brian, looking up at Archer. Peter marches off along the jetty away from Brian, leaving him pacing furiously, hands on hips then on his head in despair. In a home game, a Luton Town player in orange stripe weaves through the lead-footed Leeds midfield as Clough sits beside Bremner sulking on the bench. Behind them, a seat with the directors is made for by Don, who eyes Brian gloatingly. A goal is scored by a Luton striker and the Leeds fans cheer as Brian escorts his team down the tunnel, finding Cussins waiting. The dressing room is trudged into by the Leeds players as Cussins leaves Brian with his hands on his hips. Bremner is followed by Brian into the dressing room, but the door is slammed in his face. The directors are joined by the players, now showered and in their fashionable clothes, in the long, narrow lounge, with Brian traipsing in last to face Cussins. Cussins eyeballs Brian then turns to the players as a player obliges. Brian's nose is wrinkled with distaste as Bremner, sat beside him, winks at him. Brian nods and swallows hard, his new young signings looking troubled as their manager steps into the corridor. The door is found by Jimmy outside with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian smarts, straightens his jacket, and glances around the board members as Cussins glances at the other directors. Nigel is led down the corridor by Brian, passing Don's photo, then makeup is found by him for Yorkshire TV. The door is knocked on by the presenter, and Brian winks and smiles wistfully. Now, in the studio, Brian is led by the floor manager to his seat before the cameras. Two other chairs are noticed by Brian as he sits, and the tall, handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dark studio into the lights of the set.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Brian wryly smiles, folds his arms, leans forward, and shakes the chairman's hand. On a crowded tourist beach by a Majorcan hotel, Brian plays football bare-chested with his kids and Peter in an impromptu game. Holidaymakers laze on lounges as a man applies cream on his obese body. Brian kisses Peter's cheek playfully and raises his arms in celebration after scoring, while Barbara and the kids frolic in the surf. Wearing aviator shades, Brian smiles, nodding as they beckon him. His face turns serious as he views the back page sports headline. By the hotel, a waiter points Brian out to a man in a panama hat and blazer carrying a briefcase towards him. The man dabs sweat from his face as he stands over Brian, who raises onto his elbows, intrigued, looking up at Archer. Peter walks off along the jetty, leaving Brian pacing with hands on hips, then in despair. In a home game, a Luton Town player in orange stripes weaves through the Leeds midfield as Bremner sulks beside Clough. Behind, Don heads to a director's seat, eyeing Brian gloatingly. A Luton striker scores, and Leeds fans cheer. Brian escorts his team down the tunnel to find Cussins waiting. Leeds players trudge into the dressing room as Cussins leaves Brian with hands on hips. Brian tries following Bremner into the room but is shut out. Players, now showered and dressed, join directors in a lounge, with Brian entering last to face Cussins. As Cussins eyes Brian, Bremner winks at him. Brian nods, swallows hard; young signings look troubled as he steps into the corridor. Jimmy finds Brian with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian straightens his jacket and glances at board members; Cussins does the same. Brian leads Nigel down the corridor, passing Don's photo, and ends up in makeup for Yorkshire TV. The presenter knocks, and Brian smiles wistfully. Now in the studio, the floor manager guides Brian to his seat before cameras. Brian sees two other chairs as the tall, handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dark studio into the set's lights.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Brian smiles wryly, shakes the chairman’s hand, and later, on a crowded Majorcan beach, plays football with his kids and Peter. As holidaymakers lounge, Brian kisses Peter to celebrate scoring. Sporting aviator shades, Brian becomes serious reading a sports headline. A man in a panama hat approaches Brian, sunbathing. Brian sits up, intrigued. Peter leaves, and Brian paces in despair. During a Luton home game, a player weaves through a sluggish Leeds midfield. As a striker scores, Leeds fans cheer while Brian escorts his team, encountering Cussins. Brian attempts to enter the dressing room but is shut out. After showering, players join directors; Cussins eyes Brian, who winces at Bremner’s wink. Brian, visibly distressed, heads into the corridor. Outside, Jimmy finds Brian straightening up for a board meeting with Cussins. Brian leads Nigel past Don's photo, heading to Yorkshire TV for makeup. In the studio, a presenter introduces Brian to his seat, noticing the two chairs as Don is ushered into the set's lights.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Brian, with a wry smile on his face and his arms confidently folded across his chest, leans forward to exchange a firm handshake with the chairman. On a bustling tourist beach located near a bustling Majorcan hotel, Brian, bare-chested and relaxed, engages in a lively game of football with his children. Meanwhile, Peter joins in the spontaneous game, playfully cavorting with them. Around them, overweight holidaymakers lazily lounge on sunbeds, as a nearby man diligently applies cream to his obese folds. In the midst of this, Brian plants a playful kiss on Peter's cheek and lifts his arms high in joyous celebration, having just scored. Nearby, Barbara frolics energetically in the surf with Peter and the children, while Brian, wearing his signature aviator shades, smiles and nods, acknowledging their calls for him to join in the fun. However, his expression shifts to one of seriousness as he picks up the newspaper and turns to the back page, where a bold sports headline catches his eye. 

By the hotel, a waiter discreetly points Brian out to a man sporting a panama hat and a blazer. This man, carrying a briefcase in his hand, wanders down the sandy beach, making his way towards Brian, who is now reclining comfortably on his back under the sun. As the man in the blazer arrives, he dabs the sweat from his face while standing over Brian. Still adorned with his shades and an intrigued expression, Brian props himself up on his elbows, looking up at Archer with interest. Meanwhile, Peter marches determinedly off along the jetty, moving away from Brian, who remains pacing back and forth furiously, his hands alternating between resting on his hips and clutching his head in visible despair. 

In a home game at Luton Town, a player dressed in an orange-striped uniform skillfully weaves through the sluggish Leeds midfield. All the while, Bremner sulks beside Clough on the bench. Just behind them, Don makes his way to a seat among the directors and casts a gloating glance towards Brian. As a Luton striker scores, the Leeds fans erupt in cheers. Brian escorts his team down the tunnel, only to find Cussins waiting. The Leeds players, defeated, trudge into their dressing room, while Cussins departs, leaving Brian standing with his hands defiantly placed on his hips. As Brian attempts to follow Bremner into the dressing room, he is abruptly blocked as the door slams in his face. 

Later, the players, now refreshed from their showers and clad in fashionable clothing, join the directors in the long, narrow lounge. Brian, trailing behind, enters last to confront Cussins. A player obliges as Cussins fixes a stern gaze on Brian before turning his attention to the players. Observing Bremner sitting beside Giles, Brian wrinkles his nose with clear distaste, while Bremner gives him a sly wink. Brian acknowledges with a nod, swallowing hard, as his new, young signings look on, visibly troubled by their manager's predicament. 

Out in the corridor, Jimmy encounters Brian just outside the door, with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian, feeling the sting of the situation, straightens his jacket and glances around at the board members while Cussins exchanges glances with the other directors. Brian, leading Nigel down the corridor, passes by Don's photograph before finding himself in the makeup area for Yorkshire TV. The presenter knocks gently on the door, prompting Brian to wink and offer a wistful smile. Now settled in the studio, the floor manager guides Brian to his designated seat in front of the cameras. As Brian takes his seat, he notices two other chairs, and as the tall, handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dim studio towards the bright lights of the set, Brian looks on with anticipation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Brian, an air of amusement playing across his face thanks to the wry smile that tugs at his lips, maintains a confident presence by folding his arms across his chest. He leans forward with a firm, decisive handshake intended for the chairman. This scene unfolds on a lively, bustling tourist beach, which is conveniently located adjacent to a busy hotel in Majorca. Here, Brian, who is bare-chested and exuding an air of relaxation, immerses himself in a spirited and entertaining game of football with his children. At the same time, Peter enthusiastically joins the impromptu game, cavorting playfully with all of them. Surrounding this lively scene are vacationers who are noticeably overweight, lounging lazily on sunbeds. Nearby, a man is meticulously applying cream to the folds of his obese skin. Amidst all this, Brian, in a moment filled with playful affection, plants a kiss on Peter's cheek, then lifts his arms high in a gesture of joyous celebration after scoring. Nearby, Barbara is frolicking with boundless energy in the surf alongside Peter and the children. Brian, wearing his signature aviator sunglasses, smiles and nods, acknowledging their enthusiastic calls for him to join in the fun-filled activities. However, his mood undergoes a transformation; his expression turns serious as he picks up the newspaper and turns to the back page where a bold sports headline captures his attention.

By the hotel, a discreet waiter points Brian out to a man who is fashionably dressed in a panama hat and a blazer. This man, carrying a briefcase in his hand, meanders down the sandy beach, purposefully making his way toward Brian, who is now comfortably reclining on his back, basking under the warm sun. As the man in the blazer arrives at his destination, he pauses to dab the sweat from his face while standing authoritatively over Brian. Brian, still donning his aviator shades and with an expression of intrigue and curiosity written all over his face, props himself up on his elbows, looking up at Archer with palpable interest. Meanwhile, Peter takes a decisive march along the jetty, his little legs carrying him away from Brian, who remains in place, pacing back and forth with visible agitation. His hands alternate between resting on his hips and clutching his head, a perfect picture of despair.

In another scene, during a home game at Luton Town, a player, resplendent in an orange-striped uniform, skillfully weaves his way through the sluggish Leeds midfield. All the while, Bremner sits sulking beside Clough on the bench, a picture of discontent. Just behind them, Don makes his strategic way to a seat among the directors, where he casts a smug, gloating glance in Brian's direction. As a Luton striker makes a successful score, the Leeds fans burst into jubilant cheers. Brian, attempting to maintain composure, escorts his team down the tunnel, only to find Cussins waiting there. The Leeds players, cloaked in defeat, trudge into their dressing room, while Cussins departs, leaving Brian standing with his hands defiantly positioned on his hips. As Brian endeavours to follow Bremner into the dressing room, his path is abruptly blocked by the door slamming shut in his face.

Later on, after having refreshed themselves with showers and now decked out in stylish and fashionable attire, the players join the directors in the long, narrow lounge. Brian, trailing behind the others, enters last, his focus squarely on confronting Cussins. A player obligingly steps aside as Cussins fixes a stern, unwavering gaze on Brian before shifting his focus to the players. Observing Bremner seated beside Giles, Brian wrinkles his nose in a clear expression of distaste, while Bremner responds with a sly, cheeky wink. Brian acknowledges this with a nod, swallowing hard as he does so, aware of the troubled looks on the faces of his new, young signings who are witnessing their manager's predicament.

Out in the corridor, Jimmy encounters Brian just outside the door, with Manny Cussins situated in the boardroom. Brian, feeling the sting of the challenging situation he finds himself in, straightens his jacket and casts a glance around at the board members as Cussins exchanges meaningful glances with the other directors. Leading Nigel down the corridor, Brian passes by Don's photograph before finding himself in the makeup area for Yorkshire TV. The presenter knocks gently on the door, prompting Brian to wink and offer a wistful smile in response. Now settled into the studio environment, the floor manager deftly guides Brian to his assigned seat in front of the cameras. As Brian takes his seat, he notices the presence of two other chairs, and as the tall, handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dimly lit studio towards the bright lights of the set, Brian looks on with anticipation and interest.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Brian, with a wry smile and arms folded, leans forward to firmly grip the chairman's hand in a handshake. On a bustling tourist beach beside a Majorcan hotel, he, bare-chested, energetically kicks a football around with his kids, as Peter joins in their spontaneous match, playfully darting around the sandy field. Nearby, overweight holidaymakers recline lazily on lounge chairs, while one man meticulously rubs sunscreen into the creases of his sizable body. In a moment of exuberance, Brian affectionately plants a playful kiss on Peter's cheek and triumphantly lifts his arms skyward to celebrate a goal, as Barbara joyously splashes in the surf along with Peter and the children. Sporting aviator sunglasses, Brian smiles and nods in acknowledgment of their gestures, inviting him to join the fun. However, his expression shifts to one of seriousness as he flips over the back page of the newspaper, scanning the sports headline. By the hotel, a waiter discreetly points Brian out to a gentleman in a panama hat and blazer, prompting this man to meander down the sandy strip, briefcase in hand, till he arrives at Brian, who lies sunbathing on his back. The man in the blazer wipes perspiration from his face while standing over Brian, who, still shaded by his aviators and with a look of intrigue, props himself up on his elbows to peer up at Archer. Meanwhile, Peter strides purposefully away along the jetty, leaving Brian pacing back and forth with mounting frustration, alternating between gripping his hips and cradling his head in despair. During a home game, a Luton Town player in an orange-striped kit deftly navigates through the sluggish Leeds midfield, as Bremner pouts beside Clough on the bench. Behind them, Don confidently strides to a director's seat, glancing smugly in Brian's direction. A Luton striker successfully scores, prompting cheers from the Leeds fans as Brian leads his team down the tunnel, where he encounters Cussins waiting. The Leeds players wearily file into their dressing room while Cussins departs, leaving Brian standing with hands defiantly on his hips. As Brian attempts to follow Bremner into the dressing room, the door is abruptly shut in his face. Later, the players, now showered and donned in fashionable attire, mingle with directors in a long, narrow lounge, and Brian is the last to enter, facing Cussins. A player complies as Cussins fixes a piercing gaze on Brian before addressing the players. Brian, wrinkling his nose in distaste, catches Bremner, seated beside Giles, winking at him. Brian nods, swallowing hard, aware his new, younger signings seem uneasy as their manager makes his way into the corridor. Jimmy encounters Brian outside the door, with Manny Cussins in the boardroom beyond. Brian, feeling the sting of the situation, straightens his jacket, casting a glance around the board members as Cussins shares a knowing look with the other directors. Resolutely, Brian leads Nigel down the corridor, passing a photo of Don, and ultimately finds himself in the makeup room of Yorkshire TV. The presenter knocks, prompting Brian to respond with a wink and a wistful smile. In the studio, the floor manager guides Brian to his seat before the cameras, where he notes the presence of two additional chairs. Settling in, Brian watches as the tall, handsome presenter escorts a bullish Don through the dim studio into the bright lights of the set.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Brian wryly smiles with folded arms, then leans forward to shake the chairman's hand. On a crowded Majorcan hotel beach, he plays football with his kids and Peter, celebrating a goal by kissing Peter's cheek. Barbara plays in the surf with them, and they invite Brian to join. His mood shifts as he reads a sports headline, and a waiter points him out to a man in a panama hat, who approaches carrying a briefcase. Curious, Brian raises himself up to face the man, Archer. Peter storms off along the jetty, leaving Brian pacing in despair.

During a home game, a Luton Town player surpasses the Leeds midfield while Brian and Bremner sit on the bench. Don watches from the directors' area, and as a Luton striker scores, Brian leads his team down the tunnel to find Cussins waiting. He attempts to follow Bremner into the dressing room but is shut out. Later, Brian enters the lounge last, facing Cussins, while the players mingle with the directors. Cussins engages with the players, and Brian, noticing Bremner's wink, nods and swallows hard. He steps into the corridor, troubled by his new signings’ concern, and encounters Jimmy outside the boardroom. After straightening up, Brian exchanges glances with the board before leading Nigel down the corridor, past Don's photo, and prepares for Yorkshire TV. In the studio, the presenter leads him to his seat before the cameras as Don is ushered into the set's lights.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Brian smiles wryly with his arms folded, then leans forward and shakes the chairman's hand, the head of the company overseeing the football club. On a crowded tourist beach by a Majorcan hotel, a popular vacation destination known for its stunning Mediterranean coastline, Brian is bare-chested playing football with his kids, while Peter, his close friend since college, cavorts around with them in the impromptu game. Fat holiday-makers laze on lounges, typical of the relaxing yet often indulgent lifestyle of tourists in Majorca, as a man smears some cream, likely sunscreen, over his obese folds. Brian kisses Peter's cheek playfully and holds his arms aloft to celebrate scoring, as Barbara, his wife renowned for her carefree spirit, frolics in the surf with Peter and the kids. Wearing aviator shades, which have become his signature look, Brian nods smiling, with them beckoning him to join. His face becomes sober as he turns over the back page of the paper to see the sport headline, possibly relating to his team's latest performance. By the hotel, a waiter points Brian out to a man in a panama hat and blazer, who wanders down the sandy beach carrying a briefcase towards Brian, now lying on his back in the sun. The man in the blazer, likely a club official, dabs sweat from his face as he stands over Brian. Still wearing his shades and an intrigued expression, Brian raises himself up onto his elbows, looking up at Archer, known to be a resourceful sports agent. Peter marches off along the jetty away from Brian, leaving him pacing furiously, hands on hips then on his head in despair, over his team's recent controversy. In a home game, a Luton Town player in orange stripe weaves through the lead-footed Leeds midfield, which has been struggling this season, as Bremner sulks beside Clough on the bench. Behind them, Don, a seasoned football strategist, makes his way to a seat with the directors and eyes Brian gloatingly. A Luton striker scores and the Leeds fans, passionate and loyal, cheer as Brian escorts his team down the tunnel, finding Cussins, the club chairman, waiting. The Leeds players trudge into their dressing room as Cussins leaves Brian with his hands on his hips. Brian makes to follow Bremner, the team captain, into the dressing room but has the door slammed in his face. The players, now showered and in their fashionable clothes reflecting the latest trends, join the directors in the long, narrow lounge, with Brian traipsing in last to face Cussins. A player obliges, as Cussins eyeballs Brian then turns to the players. Brian wrinkles his nose with distaste as Bremner, sat beside Giles, a midfield legend, winks at him. Brian nods and swallows hard, his new young signings looking troubled as their manager steps into the corridor. Jimmy, a veteran coach, finds Brian outside the door, with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian smarts, straightens his jacket, and glances around the board members as Cussins glances at the other directors, each pondering the team's future. Brian leads Nigel, a promising young player, down the corridor, passing Don's photo, then finds himself in makeup for Yorkshire TV, a regional channel known for its sports coverage. The presenter knocks on the door, and Brian winks and smiles wistfully, reflecting on his media persona. Now, in the studio, the floor manager leads Brian to his seat before the cameras. Brian notices two other chairs and sits as the tall, handsome presenter, a familiar face on television, leads a bullish Don through the dark studio into the lights of the set, set to discuss the team's prospects.

Brian notices two other chairs and sits as the tall handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dark studio into the lights of the set.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Brian smiles wryly with his arms folded then leans forward and shakes the chairman's hand. On a crowded tourist beach by a Majorcan hotel Brian is barechested playing football with his kids while Peter cavorts around with them in the impromptu game. Fat holidaymakers laze on lounges as a man smears some cream over his obese folds. Brian kisses Peter's cheek playfully and holds his arms aloft to celebrate scoring. as Barbara frolics in the surf with Peter and the kids. Wearing aviator shades Brian nods smiling with them beckoning him to join. His face becomes sober as he turns over the back page of the paper to see the sport headline. By the hotel a waiter points Brian out to a man in a panama hat and blazer who wanders down the sandy beach carrying a briefcase towards Brian now lying on his back in the sun. The man in the blazer dabs sweat from his face as he stands over Brian. Still wearing his shades and an intrigued expression. Brian raises himself up onto his elbows looking up at Archer. Peter marches off along the jetty away from Brian leaving him pacing furiously hands on hips then on his head in despair. In a home game a Luton Town player in orange stripe weaves through the leadfooted Leeds midfield as Bremner sulks beside Clough on the bench. Behind them Don makes his way to a seat with the directors and eyes Brian gloatingly. A Luton striker scores and the Leeds fans cheer as Brian escorts his team down the tunnel finding Cussins waiting. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. The Leeds players trudge into their dressing room as Cussins leaves Brian with his hands on his hips. Brian makes to follow Bremner into the dressing room but has the door slammed in his face. The players now showered and in their fashionable clothes join the directors in the long narrow lounge with Brian traipsing in last to face Cussins. A player obliges as Cussins eyeballs. Brian then turns to the players. Brian wrinkles his nose with distaste as Bremner sat beside. Giles winks at him. Brian nods and swallows hard his new young signings looking troubled. as their manager steps into the corridor. Jimmy finds Brian outside the door with Manny Cussins in the boardroom. Brian smarts straightens his jacket and glances around the board members as Cussins glances at the other directors. Brian leads Nigel down the corridor passing Don's photo then finds himself in makeup for Yorkshire TV. The presenter knocks on the door and Brian winks and smiles wistfully. Now in the studio the floor manager leads Brian to his seat before the cameras. Brian notices two other chairs and sits as the tall handsome presenter leads a bullish Don through the dark studio into the lights of the set.

test_cases.description: Brian smiles wryly with his arms folded then leans forward and shakes the chairman's hand. On a crowded tourist beach by a Majorcan hotel Brian is barechested playing football with his kids while Peter cavorts around with them in the impromptu game. Fat holidaymakers laze on lounges as a man smears some cream over his obese folds. The presenter knocks on the door and Brian winks and smiles wistfully. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Garrett chuckles slyly with his legs crossed, then leans backward and bumps the magician's shoulder. On a bustling farmer's market by a Tasmanian motel, Garrett is bare-headed juggling pineapples with his friends, while Lucas prances around with them in the spontaneous routine. Thin hikers loaf on hammocks as a woman drizzles some sauce over her lean salad. Garrett nudges Lucas's ear playfully and lifts his legs aloft to declare winning, as Margaret skips in the puddles with Lucas and the friends. Wearing detective hats, Garrett winks laughing, with them calling him to follow. His face grows cheerful as he peeks under the front page of the journal to notice the weather article. Near the motel, a dancer gestures Garrett out to a lady in a sunhat and cardigan, who meanders across the rocky shore clutching a backpack towards Garrett, now sitting upright in the shade. The lady in the cardigan pats dust from her shoes as she stands beside Garrett. Still wearing his hat and an amused demeanor, Garrett lowers himself down onto his knees, peering up at Vance. Lucas strolls off along the pier away from Garrett, leaving him stomping calmly, feet on shoulders then on his knees in disbelief. In an away match, a Glasgow Rovers athlete in green plaid darts around the light-footed London defense as Petersen giggles next to McKay on the sidelines. Behind them, Ray slinks his way to a perch with the referees and watches Garrett sneakily. A Glaswegian forward kicks and the London supporters applaud as Garrett directs his squad up the stairs, finding Cameron observing. The London athletes march into their locker as Cameron approaches Garrett with his feet on his knees. Garrett attempts to follow Petersen into the locker but has the entrance swung in his nose. The athletes, now dried and in their casual hats, meet the referees in the wide, short den, with Garrett shuffling in last to encounter Cameron. A drummer complies, as Cameron stares at Garrett then points to the athletes. Garrett pinches his cheek with annoyance as Petersen, stood beside Adams, smiles at him. Garrett smiles and breathes deeply, his young old draftees appearing pleased as their trainer stumbles into the foyer. Sammy spots Garrett behind the window, with Marty Cameron in the lounge. Garrett broods, tightens his belt, and peers across at the lounge visitors as Cameron peers at the other referees. Garrett guides Oliver down the foyer, crossing Rita's sketch, then finds himself in wardrobe for Tokyo Jazz. The director taps on the window, and Garrett laughs and grins thoughtfully. Now, in the theater, the light operator guides Garrett to his spot before the microphones. Garrett notes three other couches and perches as the short, bald director guides a timid Rita through the bright theater into the shadows of the floor.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Brian engages in lighthearted football with his family on a Majorcan beach, but his mood shifts when he sees a sports headline. A man in a blazer approaches him, causing Brian to become pensive. At a Luton Town home game, tension builds as Brian faces challenges with his team and interactions with Cussins. He's further isolated when the players, now showered and dressed, gather with the directors, leaving Brian to confront Cussins. After a tense moment with his team, Brian heads to Yorkshire TV for an appearance. In the studio, he sits with mixed emotions as Don, a rival, joins him under the set lights.
